lessons.title: What is JavaScript?
lessons.content: JavaScript is a high-level, dynamic programming language used to make websites interactive. It runs in the browser and on servers using Node.js.

lessons.title: How JavaScript Works
lessons.content: JavaScript runs in browsers using engines like V8. It uses a single-threaded call stack, event loop, and Web APIs to handle async tasks.

lessons.title: Setup Environment
lessons.content: Install Node.js, use VS Code, and set up a project folder with index.js to start coding in JavaScript.

lessons.title: Variables
lessons.content: Variables store data. Use const for fixed values, let for reassignable ones, and avoid var in modern JavaScript.

lessons.title: Data Types
lessons.content: JavaScript has primitive types (string, number, boolean, null, undefined, symbol, bigint) and reference types like objects and arrays.

lessons.title: Operators
lessons.content: Arithmetic, comparison, logical, and assignment operators help manipulate values in JavaScript.

lessons.title: Conditionals
lessons.content: Use if, else, else-if, and switch statements to run different code based on conditions.

lessons.title: Function Basics
lessons.content: Functions are reusable blocks of code defined with function declarations, expressions, or arrow functions.

lessons.title: Arrow Functions
lessons.content: Arrow functions provide a shorter syntax and lexically bind 'this'. Example: const sum = (a, b) => a + b.

lessons.title: Scope & Hoisting
lessons.content: Scope defines variable accessibility. Hoisting moves declarations to the top of their scope, allowing limited use before definition.

lessons.title: Selecting Elements
lessons.content: Use querySelector, getElementById, and class selectors to grab HTML elements.

lessons.title: Updating Elements
lessons.content: Manipulate text, HTML, or CSS using innerText, innerHTML, and style properties.

lessons.title: Event Listeners
lessons.content: Listen to clicks, keyboard input, and other events with addEventListener.

lessons.title: Callbacks
lessons.content: Callbacks are functions passed as arguments to other functions to handle async tasks, sometimes causing callback hell.

lessons.title: Promises
lessons.content: Promises represent async outcomes and can be handled using .then(), .catch(), and .finally().

lessons.title: Async/Await
lessons.content: Async/await makes async code cleaner. Example: const data = await fetch(url).then(res => res.json()).

lessons.title: Objects Basics
lessons.content: Objects store key-value pairs. Properties can be accessed using dot notation or bracket notation.

lessons.title: Arrays & Methods
lessons.content: Arrays store lists of values. Use push, pop, shift, map, filter, and reduce to manipulate lists.

lessons.title: Destructuring
lessons.content: Destructuring extracts values from arrays or objects into variables directly.

lessons.title: Let & Const
lessons.content: ES6 introduced let and const for block scoping and improved variable management.

lessons.title: Spread & Rest
lessons.content: Spread expands arrays/objects, while rest groups multiple arguments into a single array.

lessons.title: Template Literals
lessons.content: Use backticks (`) to embed variables using ${}. Supports multiline strings.

lessons.title: Try & Catch
lessons.content: Use try/catch to handle runtime errors gracefully and prevent script crashes.

lessons.title: Throwing Errors
lessons.content: Use throw to create custom errors when invalid conditions are detected.

lessons.title: Finally Block
lessons.content: The finally block always runs, making it ideal for cleanup operations.

lessons.title: Fetch API
lessons.content: Fetch allows you to make HTTP requests and retrieve data from servers.

lessons.title: LocalStorage
lessons.content: LocalStorage stores key-value pairs in the browser permanently (until cleared).

lessons.title: Geolocation API
lessons.content: The Geolocation API retrieves the user's current location coordinates.

lessons.title: Calculator App
lessons.content: Build a calculator using DOM methods, event listeners, and basic logic.

lessons.title: Todo List
lessons.content: Create a todo list that adds, deletes, and stores tasks in LocalStorage.

lessons.title: Weather App
lessons.content: Fetch live weather data using Fetch API and display it dynamically.
